original English: I must take you two to improve my ranking today.

original Spanish: Tal vez es el arma afilado para controlar el farol.
original English: Maybe it is a powerful weapon for us to drive through the Waters of Death and defeat the Lantern Ghost King.

original Spanish: La última vez llevé a mis hermanos al calabozo para salvarte.
original English: Last time when I went to save you in the ice prison with our brothers.

original Spanish: Come algo bueno para nutrir la salud
original English: Have something good to eat. Make up for your body.

original Spanish: Hace veinte años para enfrentar la deficiencia de recursos futuros
original English: Twenty years ago to meet the extreme lack of resources in the future

original Spanish: Luo Dayong y yo como investigadores hemos sido ordenados para investigar que puede evolucionar rápidamente el cuerpo humano para adaptarse a la supervivencia del océano.
original English: Luo Dayong and I were appointed as researchers to develop a reagent that can evolve human body real fast to adapt to living in the sea.

original Spanish: Convoca a los otros cuatro reinos para enviar una orden secreta a los piratas marinos.
original English: Assemble the other four kings and send out a secret order to all pirates on the sea.

original Spanish: Todo se usa para el motor del vapor para el vapor se encarga de abrir y excavar
original English: He is in charge of the excavating and mining of all the coals and minerals used for steam power.

original Spanish: Si la persigues para perseguirla.
original English: It might be hard for you to go after her.

original Spanish: Para salvarla para salvarla.
original English: In order to save her I did an experiment on her privately.

original Spanish: Todo esto es para atraerte.
original English: I did all these things just for attracting you here.

original Spanish: Solo para que la búsqueda de nuevo continente de encontrar un nuevo continente.
original English: The purpose is to make the show of looking for the new land more real.

original Spanish: Puedo darte todo mi dinero para que tu hija tenga el mejor tratamiento
original English: I can give all my money to you so that your daughter can receive the best treatment.

original Spanish: estoy dispuesto a usar mi sangre para salvar a tu hija.
original English: I'm willing to save your daugther with my own blood.

original Spanish: Si es posible por favor déjame usar el resto de mi vida la botella para disculparse.
original English: If I could please let me repent of and atone forâ¦ -Bottle. -Bottle.

original Spanish: No hay motivo para desesperarse un bote hundido es nuestra salvación y tres sacos de grano de cebada nuestro puerto.
original English: There's no cause for grief a sunken dory supplies our relief three barley grain casks our dock.

original Spanish: A comienzos del siglo XVI un grupo de españoles consiguen con la astucia conquistar Méjico sometiendo a cien mil guerreros aztecas y a un pueblo que poseía riquezas para comprar el mundo.
original English: At the beginning of the 16th century a band of Spaniards succeeded by guile to conquer Mexico subjugating a hundred thousand Aztec warriors and a people who possessed wealth quite sufficient to buy the world.

original Spanish: Y los españoles aprovecharon el hecho de que su llegada a tierras mejicanas coincidiera con la fecha fijada por la leyenda para el esperado regreso del Blanco Nume.
original English: And the Spaniards took advantage of the fact that their arrival on Mexican soil corresponded with the date fixed by the legend for the long-awaited return of the white God.

original Spanish: - - He venido de muy lejos prima mía para pedir tu mano de esposa.
original English: I have come from afar my cousin to ask for your hand in marriage!

original Spanish: - Con estos dos jefes de tribu id al encuentro de los extranjeros ofrecedles preciosos dones y convencedles para que partan.
original English: With these two heads of tribes visit the foreigners... and by giving them precious gifts persuade them to go!

original Spanish: - No somos enemigos pero queremos entrar a toda costa en vuestra ciudad para que los aztecas se postren ante la Cruz.
original English: We do not want to be enemies but at all costs we must come into your city... because the Aztecs must bow down before the Cross".

original Spanish: Vengo aquí para recibir tu homenaje y para guiar hacia la Cruz a tu pueblo que ahora yace en las tinieblas de la idolatría.
original English: ... I come here to receive from you a tribute and to drive your people... now lying in the darkness of idolatry towards the Cross".

original Spanish: - Pero si puedo abriros esa puerta para salvar al capitán ¿abandonaréis la ciudad sin querer conquistarla? - ¿Lo juráis?
original English: But after I have given you the way to save your captain... you will leave the city without attempting to conquer it?

original Spanish: Del campo no crecerá ni un grano para alimentarte.
original English: Arid will be each land whereon thou shalt live! ...

original Spanish: Y todos los dioses incluso el de los cristianos te olvidarán para la eternidad.
original English: ... The Sun will no more give light to your eyes! ...

original Spanish: Ya que no hay súbditos para gobernar ¡déjame morir aquí junto a mi padre que murió por su pueblo!
original English: No! I will not try to save myself! Since I have no more subjects to govern let me die here at the side of my father who died for his people!

original Spanish: ¡Habría que matarse los unos a los otros para poseerlo!
original English: If you have to cut each others throats to possess this treasure... then to hell with it!

original Spanish: Von Reizenstein se prepara para cumplir su pena.
original English: Von Reizenstein gets ready to serve time.

original Spanish: La señora está para besarla.
original English: Madame looks good enough to kiss.

original Spanish: La magnífica gran pintura del pintor LIND fue comprada en la exposición para el Museo.
original English: The magnificent painting by Lind was bought at the exposition by the museum.

original Spanish: Prométeme que vas a utilizar todos tus esfuerzos para el divorcio.
original English: Promise me you will attempt everything in order to get a divorce.

original Spanish: El notario notifica a Lena las deudas de su marido y que para pagarlas tendría que vender sus posesiones.
original English: The accountant notified Margrit of her husband's debts and that to pay those all her possessions would have to be sold.

original Spanish: Por Lena que ahora está en la pobreza para proporcionarle un medio de vida busca su antiguo amigo Kruger un cabaret cuyo propietario es un conocido suyo.
original English: Margrit's old pal Kruger forwards Margrit now impoverished to an acquaintance's cabaret so she can provide herself the means to live.

original Spanish: Knud el hermano de Frits llega a la ciudad para hacer compras.
original English: Knud Arvid's brother travels to the city for his purchases.

original Spanish: Mañana se cumplirá nuestro deseo todo está preparado para la huida.
original English: Tomorrow our desire will be fulfilled the escape has been fully prepared.

original Spanish: Durante muchos meses Ushakapilla ha estado acumulando tesoros para comprar armas y munición para la revuelta que planea.
original English: For many months Ushakapilla has been hoarding booty to buy weapons and ammunition for the planned uprising.

original Spanish: Tras su llegada a África alquiló el Lord inmediatamente un tren especial para dirigirse a Rhodesia...
original English: Arriving in Africa the noble lord immediately hired a special train to get to Rhodesia...

original Spanish: Al llegar a Rhodesia Lord Cholmondeley se dirigió al único hotel del pequeño poblado de Seijaduntella para que el mundo se olvidara de él.
original English: Arriving in Rhodesia Lord Cholmondeley checked into the only hotel in the little settlement of Seijaduntella in order that the world might forget him utterly.

original Spanish: Ya te encontraré algún sitio para que duermas.
original English: Ich werde schon irgend eine Schlafstelle für Dich finden.

original Spanish: Buscando venados para la mesa de su padre
original English: Looking for game to put on her father's table

original Spanish: Con alegría daré mi consentimiento para que estudiéis con mi amigo blanco.
original English: I will gladly allow you to study under my white friend.

original Spanish: Voy a buscar a mi amigo Jack para que no lo destrocen los leones.
original English: I will fetch my friend Jack lest he be torn apart by lions.

original Spanish: Tal vez tenga tiempo para ayudarte en tus clases de inglés.
original English: Maybe I will find the time to help you with your language lessons.

original Spanish: Gestionando nuestro trabajo para la Cruz Roja con la señora Smith.
original English: I have taken care of our work for the Red Cross with mrs. Smith.

original Spanish: ¡Ha venido desde Japón para matarte!
original English: He has come here all the way from Japan to kill you.

original Spanish: Sí fui un estúpido pero ahora ya sé quién eres. ¡Tendré ese papel aunque deba aplastarte para conseguirlo!
original English: Yes I was a fool. But I've found out who and what you are ...and I will have the paper even if I have to crush you for it!

original Spanish: Vine a América para vengar a mi madre... ¡no para convertirme en un ladrón!
original English: I've come to Amerika to avenge my mother... not to become a thief!

original Spanish: El padre del príncipe Kossotski coronel retirado de la guardia antes de su muerte testa para que su hijo se incorpore al ejército.
original English: The father of Prince Kossotski colonel of the guard in retirement had pronounced as he lay dying his wish that his son follow a career in the army.

original Spanish: Me desnudaré para secarme.
original English: I must undress to dry myself ...

original Spanish: He hipotecado nuestra casa para comprar una mina de cobre.
original English: I've mortgaged our home to buy a copper mine.

original Spanish: Pero ahora mismo necesito un millón para ponerla en marcha.
original English: But right now I need a million to get it going.

original Spanish: Demasiado bella para ser una sirvienta.
original English: Much too beautiful to be a maid.

original Spanish: Usted está casada y yo podría para ser su padre.
original English: You are married and I'm old enough to be your father.

original Spanish: Si se me hace tarde para coger un tren normalmente suelo coger el especial.
original English: If I'm late for my train I usually charter a special.

original Spanish: Me llevaré tu ropa para que no escapes.
original English: I'll take your clothes with me so I know you won't run away.

original Spanish: Anna Karenina se encuentra con la condesa Vronskaya en la estación quien viaja para ver a su hijo en Moscú.
original English: Anna Karenina meets Countess Vronskaya at the station who is travelling to see her son in Moscow.

original Spanish: - Me temo que si me enfrento a él no tendré fuerzas suficientes para insistir en el divorcio. -
original English: I'm afraid that if I face him

original Spanish: Como Anna Karenina no puede recuperar su libertad envía a su hermano para que hable con Karenin.
original English: Since Anna Karenina could not regain her freedom she sends her brother to Karenin.

original Spanish: Te pido Karenin que me perdones para que pueda morir con tranquilidad.
original English: I am asking you Karenin to forgive me so that I can die with peace of mind. Anna

original Spanish: Sólo estoy aquí para cumplir el último deseo de Anna.
original English: I am only here to fulfill Anna's final wish.

original Spanish: En 1921 se modificó mucho el negativo original para la versión americana GIPSY BLOOD.
original English: In 1921 the original negative was heavily altered for the American version of the film Gypsy Blood.

original Spanish: La base para la restauración digital de la Fundación Friedrich-Wilhelm-Murnau en 2018 fue un duplicado incompleto del archivo en blanco y negro del Archivo Estatal de Cine de la RDA.
original English: The basis for the digital restoration of the Friedrich Wilhelm Murnau Foundation in 2018 was an incomplete black-and-white archive duplicate from the former holdings of the State Film Archive of the GDR.

original Spanish: Éstos también sirvieron como base para el esquema de color que sin embargo sigue siendo en gran medida especulativo.
original English: These also served as the basis for the colour plan which however remains largely speculative.

original Spanish: Perdona tengo que dejarte sola un momento hermosa niña para controlar a los presos.
original English: Excuse me I have to leave you alone for a moment beautiful child to check on the prisoners.

original Spanish: Ve al barrio gitano y consigue una buena bailarina para la fiesta.
original English: Go to the gypsy quarter and arrange a good dancer for the feast.

original Spanish: Hemos de separarnos tengo que ir a Gibraltar para explorar buenas oportunidades.
original English: We have to part I must go to Gibraltar seek out some good opportunities.

original Spanish: He enviado a casa a los sirvientes esta tarde para evitar testigos indiscretos.
original English: Struggle for Life: I sent home the servants this afternoon so we'll avoid any witnesses.

original Spanish: Sabiendo que soy rico y huérfano usted y su hermano me han introducido cobardemente en su pervertido mundo para así poder explotarme pero ahora puedo ver con claridad y quiero abandonar esta degradante vida.
original English: Knowing that I'm rich and an orphan you and your brother have cowardly conceded to luring me into your perverted world so you can exploit me but I can see clearly now and want to leave this demeaning life. I'll do anything to make it happen.

original Spanish: Le daré todo el dinero que necesita para empezar una nueva vida.
original English: I'll give all the money you need to start a new life.

original Spanish: Su criado me telefoneó esta mañana para decirme la razón de este duelo.
original English: You telephoned me this morning to tell me the reason for this duel. You do not...

original Spanish: Mañana 2 en punto Villa Floreal preparada para partir.
original English: Tomorrow 2 o'clock Villa Floreal be ready to leave.

original Spanish: ¿Cree que voy a dejarle vivo para que mate a mi padre en un duelo?
original English: Do you think I can let him go alive to then go and kill my father in a duel?

original Spanish: Eve me esperaba para el té... ha vuelto conmigo!
original English: She has returned with me!

original Spanish: Todo está listo para viajar en barco.
original English: All fixed up for the boat ride.

original Spanish: Hasta ahora la tradición en Huseby para las hijas de los granjeros ... no es compartir la alcoba matrimonial con hijos de minifundistas.
original English: As yet there is no tradition here on Huseby for farmers' daughters ...to share the marriage bed with smallholders' sons.

original Spanish: Noble Señor vuestro sirviente cuidó los Lugares Sagrados para que nadie los profane!
original English: Noble Lord Your servant is guarding the Holy Shrine from the trampling of foreign feet!

original Spanish: Oh Take-San sería una excelente geisha para el dueño de la casa de té.
original English: O-Take-San would be a very good Geisha for the keeper of the Teahouse.

original Spanish: Esta es la espada que mi padre usó para suicidarse por orden del Mikado"!
original English: This is the sword with which my father killed himself by order of the Mikado!

original Spanish: ...y si ella no tiene dinero para comprar su libertad"! ...
original English: ...and if she has no money to buy herself free!"...

original Spanish: Ven Hanake decoremos la casa con flores para recibirlo!
original English: Come Hanake let us decorate the house with flowers for the reception!

original Spanish: Iré al consulado para que me informen!
original English: I'm going to the consulate to ask for him!

original Spanish: Bastante después de medianoche unos pocos hombres salieron de la posada de Branehög para ensillar sus caballos y volver a casa.
original English: Long after mignight a few men left the inn at Branehög in order to saddle their horses and return home.

original Spanish: No soy lo suficientemente rica como para alimentarte y vestirte Elsalill... para que puedas estar sin hacer nada y sigas alimentando tu dolor.
original English: I am not wealthy enough Elsalill to feed and clothe you-- so that you may remain idle and nurture your grief.

original Spanish: ¡Espero que estén vivos para poder arrancarles el corazón del pecho!
original English: I hope they are alive so I may rip their hearts from their chests!

original Spanish: ¡Espero que estén vivos para poder verlos destrozados y descuartizados!
original English: I hope they are alive so I may see them drawn and quartered!

original Spanish: No hemos venido para asustarla sino a pedirle que comparta su relato con nosotros.
original English: We did not come to frighten you good maiden but to ask you to share your tale with us.

original Spanish: Vinimos a Marstrand para reservar pasaje hacia Escocia pero todos los fiordos y los estrechos están helados.
original English: We came to Marstrand to book passage to Scotland but all the fjords and sounds are frozen.

original Spanish: ¡Muéstrale al caballero que no careces de educación para responderle adecuadamente Elsalill!
original English: Show the gentleman you do not lack the breeding to respond properly Elsalill!

original Spanish: Naciste para pertenecer a la clase alta y no eres una humilde vendedora de pescado.
original English: You were born to a higher station and are not a lowly fish wench.

original Spanish: Después de ese día Sir Archie iría con frecuencia a la casa de Torarin para hablar con Elsalill.
original English: After that day Sir Archie often ventured to Torarin's cottage to speak to Elsalill.

original Spanish: Solicitó pasaje para Escocia para él y sus hombres pero no me gusta llevar a ese tipo de rufianes a bordo de mi barco.
original English: He requested passage to Scotland for himself and his men but I do not like to have such ruffians aboard my vessel.

original Spanish: Debes acudir conmigo a las autoridades para que puedan detener a los asesinos y castigarlos como se merecen.
original English: You must go with me to the rightful authorities so they may seize the murderers and duly punish them.

original Spanish: Quién sabe qué era lo que le obsesionaba tanto como para estar a la intemperie en una noche como aquella.
original English: Who could know what possessed the skipper to be out on such a night as this.

original Spanish: Habían ido a recoger a la joven doncella que había amado a un malhechor... y había sacrificado su vida para destruirlo.
original English: They had come to collect the young maiden who had loved an evildoer... and had given her life to destroy him.

original Spanish: La música para Sir Arne's Treasure es el resultado de la colaboración entre Swedish Film Institute y Swedish Filmindustry
original English: The musical score for Sir Arne's Treasure is the result of a collaboration between the Swedish Film Institute and Swedish Filmindustry

original Spanish: Lo dije sólo para que ella tuviera una sentencia más apacible".
original English: I said it just so that she would get a milder sentence.

original Spanish: Pero no es tan fácil para mí casarme con ella.
original English: But it isn't so easy for me to marry her.

original Spanish: Si su padre quiere rechazarla para congraciarse con usted
original English: If her father wants to reject her in order to ingratiate himself to you

original Spanish: Estoy seguro que está enviando al padre de Brita aquí para mostrarme qué malo es querer que lleve toda la verguenza sola.
original English: I'm sure he's sent Brita's father here to show me how wicked it is to want "to let her bear all the blame alone.

original Spanish: que en estos últimos días no tengo mucho deseo para ir y conseguirla.
original English: that in these last few days I haven't had much desire to go and get her.

original Spanish: ...no hay nada para ser ganado en su regreso primero es mejor evitar el encuentro.
original English: ...there is nothing to be gained in your coming home first it's better to avoid meeting.

original Spanish: Sí pero el Gran Ingmar me ha traído aquí para sacar a mi novia de la cárcel.
original English: Yes but Big Ingmar has brought me here to get my bride out of jail.

original Spanish: Es demasiado grande para ponerlo en la parte de atrás de la carreta.
original English: It's too big to put on the back of the cart.

original Spanish: Él no pensó que tuviera valor para encontrarse con las lenguas afiladas.
original English: He didn't think he had the courage to meet the sharp tongues.

original Spanish: Porque no quiero traer el infortunio para Ingmar!
original English: Because I don't want to bring Ingmar misfortune!

original Spanish: No tienes derecho para leerla todavía!
original English: You don't have the right to read it yet!

original Spanish: Dios sabe que oré todos los días para poder verte antes de irme.
original English: God knows I prayed everyday that I might see you before I went.

original Spanish: Ella estaba tan contenta no sabía cómo hacer para impedir reírse.
original English: She was so happy she didn't know what to do to keep from laughing out loud.

original Spanish: Se necesita algo más que el brillo del sol y un clima hermoso para sentirse tan dichoso como uno de los niños de Dios en el cielo?
original English: Is anything needed more than sunshine and beautiful weather "to feel as blissful as one of God's children in heaven?

original Spanish: Me gustaría encontrar al Gran Ingmar para pedirle consejo sobre una situación".
original English: I would like to meet Big Ingmar to ask his advice about an awkward situation.

original Spanish: Y Brita se fue a la Granja de Ingmar antes de la boda para ayudar a Mamá.
original English: And Brita moved down to Ingmar's Farm before the wedding "in order to help mother.

original Spanish: Tenía la sospecha que Brita estaba haciendo algo sobre mí para posponer la boda
original English: I had a suspicion Brita was brooding about me postponing the wedding

original Spanish: Solo así puede quemar para él todo lo de la Granja de Ingmar!
original English: It can just as well burn up for him all of Ingmar's Farm!

original Spanish: Todo lo que puedo pensar es cómo hacer para herirlos!
original English: All I can think about is how I can hurt them!

original Spanish: Pero ahora era demasiado tarde para hacer eso.
original English: But now it was too late to do that.

original Spanish: Ella lo hizo para vengarse de mí porque me habían forzado por ella--
original English: She did it to take revenge on me because I had forced myself on her --

original Spanish: Unos días después él obtuvo el permiso de sus superiores para hacer una parada de dos horas en Orneval para que su compañía se reportara a la estación más cercana...
original English: A few days later he obtained permission from his superiors to make a two-hour stopover in Orneval as his company was to report to a nearby station...

original Spanish: No tengo más motivos para quedarme.
original English: I have no more reason to stay.

original Spanish: ella te envió ese telegrama para que te sintieras en libertad de unirte a Jean que está emboscado en alguna parte;
original English: She sent you that telegram to be free to join Jean who's lying low somewhere.

original Spanish: ¡Qué lugar para escribir cartas!
original English: What a spot to write letters!

original Spanish: Ella te envió ese telegrama para que te sintieras en libertad de unirte a Jean que está emboscado en alguna parte.
original English: She sent you that telegram to be free to join Jean who's lying low somewhere.

original Spanish: Regreso a casa para agasajar al nuevo teniente...
original English: Back home to celebrate the appointment...

original Spanish: Los cañones están atascados o yacen monstruosamente diseminados el eterno espíritu del Mal planea sobre ésta gigantesca batalla para liberar el mundo.
original English: The cannon squat or lie monstrously sprawled the eternal spirit of Evil hovers over this battle to save the world.

original Spanish: Antiguo oficial licenciado por razones de salud solicito ahora permiso para reincorporarme al servicio activo en mi antigua compañía con el rango de soldado raso de segunda a las ordenes del sargento François Laurin.
original English: I now request permission to return to active duty in my old company with the rank of Private 2nd Class under the orders of Sergeant Francois Laurin.

original Spanish: Y el visionario les dijo muchas otras cosas cosas profundas y dolorosas que no pueden emerger del barro a través de las imagenes... porque los ojos están aún tan lejos del corazón para comprender verdaderamente.
original English: And the visionary told them many other things. Profound and painful things which mustn't emerge from the mud through images because the eyes are still too far from the heart to truly understand.

original Spanish: Jean temiendo un grave peligro ha preparado una serie de cartas para Edith fechadas para los meses por venir así ella permanecería ignorante de lo sucedido tanto tiempo como fuera posible...
original English: Jean fearing the worst had prepared a series of letters for Edith pre-dated with the months to come so that she would remain ignorant as long as possible...

original Spanish: Y mientras su vida se extinguía sus febriles pensamientos eran para su querida Edith a quien había amado tanto si que ella lo supiera y quien mientras tanto debería estar riendo bajo la dulce luz de Provence.
original English: And as his life ebbed his feverish last thoughts were for his dear Edith whom he had loved so much without her knowing it and who at that moment may have been laughing in the gentle light of Provence.

original Spanish: Ven a la casa de Edith Laurin a las 10 de la noche... para tener noticias de vuestros muertos.
original English: Come to Edith Laurin's home at 10 p.m. for news of your dead. -

original Spanish: - ... ¡Y tú Darmont Bernard Chantonin todos vosotros os habéis enriquecido ávidamente con vergonzosa sangre fría para engordar vuestros bolsillos!
original English: And you Darmont Bernard Chantonin you all greedily profited from the bloodshed shamelessly to line your pockets!

original Spanish: Es porque ¡capricho amargo! ... para morir mi iré
original English: Abomination has thou clothed In robes of light

original Spanish: ¡Ahora estoy listo para rodar!
original English: Now I'm ready to roll!

original Spanish: Llevará su traje encantador para la cena también?
original English: Will you wear your charming suit for dinner as well?

original Spanish: ¿Se supone que venga desnudo para la cena?
original English: Am I supposed to come naked for dinner?

original Spanish: Llamada telefónica para el Sr. Schulze de Plauen!
original English: Phone call for Mr. Schulze from Plauen!

original Spanish: Simplemente para mostrarle ¡que no tengo timidez!
original English: Just to show you that I am not shy!

original Spanish: Por más de un año el Professor Gesellius el famoso doctor ha estado en China el hogar del opio para poder estudiar este veneno misterioso
original English: For more than a year Professor Gesellius the famous doctor had been in China the homeland of opium in order to study this mysterious poison

original Spanish: Tengo tanto que decir que es vital para la felicidad de la humanidad
original English: I have so much to say that is vital for the happiness of all mankind

original Spanish: ... para la felicidad de la humanidad ...
original English: ... for the happiness of all mankind ...

original Spanish: ... de la ausencia de alegría para que la gente mantenga los pies en el suelo
original English: ... a terrifying absence of joy thrusts people back down to earth

original Spanish: Crucé el océano para estar donde tú estás - hasta que me llegue la hora
original English: I came across the sea to be where you are - until my hour strikes

original Spanish: ¿Estás aquí para guiarme?
original English: Are you here to lead me?

original Spanish: Estas son las personas que reúnen los requisitos para ser capataz.
original English: These are the people who qualify to become foreman.

original Spanish: Dame tiempo para pensarlo.
original English: Give me time to think about it.

original Spanish: ¡Tengo una noticia muy importante para el periódico!
original English: I've got a fairly important message for the paper!

original Spanish: No vas a dejar que tu sentido de la justicia se exprese porque estás siguiendo los pasos de tu padre y eres demasiado débil para aplicar tus principios.
original English: You do not want to let speak the justice in you because you follow in the footsteps of your father and are too weak to practice your principles.

original Spanish: Es demasiado guapa como para no constituir un potente rival de la iglesia.
original English: She is too beautiful not to emerge as a powerful adversary of the Church.

original Spanish: Dile a tu señor que todos los tesoros de Ophir no serían suficientes para obtener de mí ni una sola palabra agradable.
original English: Tell your master that all the treasures of Ophir wouldn't suffice to buy a single word of love from me!

original Spanish: El más alto mandatario de la iglesia me envía para que me informe de tu fe.
original English: The highest servant of the Church has sent me to question you about your faith.

original Spanish: ¡Quiero dar una fiesta para los florentinos. Rodearme de gente alegre.
original English: I shall give a feast to the Florentines and see happy people laughing around me!

original Spanish: ¡Abra bien las verjas de mis jardines para que hasta el más pobre pueda sentirse contento!
original English: Open wide the gates of my gardens so that even the poorest feels joyful today!

original Spanish: Por eso abandonaremos la ciudad como Loth hizo en el pasado con Sodoma absteniéndonos de regresar para que el pecado no se cebe con nosotros.
original English: And that is why we shall leave this city as Lot once left Sodom and we shall not look back so that sin will attain no power over us.

original Spanish: En la montaña se iba a levantar una voz para alertar a la depravada ciudad.

original English: - Let us seclude ourselves from the world so that the plague can't get in to us!

original Spanish: Dia y noche se mantenían encendidas las hogueras para impedir la llegada de la plaga.

original Spanish: Deja de llorar por quien ya no está. ¡Los vivos están hechos para vivir!
original English: Cease from mourning the vanished the living belong to life!

original English: Dear friend I shall come to you in order to talk to you about the wretched Victorine Lippert...

original Spanish: He venido para sufrir el castigo que merezco como todo criminal.

original Spanish: Querido Sol resplandece para que no me resfríe.

original English: The Baron von Chanterelle does not wish for his lineage to die out and therefore invites all of the region's maidens to gather in the marketplace so that his nephew the sole heir may choose a fitting maiden to take as his wife.

original English: I'll see if I can set hand on that bandit you go to that cabin.

original English: You don't 'pear to have no strength to work.

original English: A woman suspected of witchcraft is thrown into the water to find out whether she is guilty or not.

original Spanish: Dos verdugos usan remos para mover a la acusada en el agua hacia donde no haga pie.
original English: Two executioners use oars to move the accused in the water where she has no support.

original Spanish: Dos hombres honorables intentan amablemente persuadirla para que confiese.
original English: Two honorable men try amiably to persuade her to confess.

original Spanish: Se situa a la acusada de espaldas en la cámara de tortura para que no hechice al juez cuando entra.
original English: The accused is taken backwards into the torture chamber so as not to bewitch the judge when entering.

original Spanish: Que empiece a sufrir para poner fin a la dureza de su corazón.
original English: Let her suffering begin so that we might put an end to the harshness of her heart.

original English: You know the punishment for those who refuse to witness against a witch?

original English: Don't you know that witches secretly smear themselves with spittle so that we might believe it to be tears?

original English: One or more traits that might make an old woman noticeable was enough to bring her to court during the witchcraft era.

original English: It is hereby decreed that the honourable magistrate of this town forbids the populace to transport the ill or plague-stricken to the hospital lest the plague spread through the streets.

original Spanish: La mayoría de las cartelas existen en el negativo original aunque fueron alargadas para la presente reconstrucción.
original English: The basis was a camera negative and a dupe negative from the Bundesarchiv-Filmarchiv Berlin.

original Spanish: Los poemas son bastante bonitos... ¡pero esto no es para publicarse!
original English: The poems are nice enough... but they are certainly not and never will be publishable material - !

original Spanish: En vista de todo esto está despedido de inmediato de su trabajo para la ciudad y sin derecho a reclamar el salario.
original English: As such you are dismissed from this day forward without claim to further wages.

original Spanish: ¡Te doy tres días para aclarar por completo este asunto ni un minuto más.
original English: I'll give you three days to clear the matter up completely; not an hour longer.

original Spanish: ¡Te hemos esperado Lorenz para llevarte a casa!
original English: We've been waiting Lorenz to bring you home!

original Spanish: Herodes lleno de supersticioso temor encerró al Profeta en un pozo abandonado para protegerle contra la violencia de la chusma y el odio de Herodias.
original English: Herod full of superstitious fear locked the Prophet in an abandoned pit to protect him from the violence of the rabble and the hatred of Herodias.

original Spanish: Mata todo lo que ama; ama todo lo que mata ya en su alma brilla un rayo de la Luz y ella parte hacia lo Desconocido para intentar resolver el misterio de sus propias palabras...
original English: Love everything that kills already in your soul shines a ray of Light and she leaves for the Unknown to try to solve the mystery of his own words...

original Spanish: ¡Ve pídele que venga para que pueda arrepentirse de sus iniquidades!
original English: Go ask him to come so he can repent of his iniquities!

original Spanish: Pon en el vino tus pequeños labios rojos para que yo pueda agotar la copa.
original English: Put your little red lips in wine so that I can exhaust the cup.

original Spanish: ¡Muerde un poco de esta fruta para que yo pueda comer el resto!
original English: Ў Bite some of this fruit so I can eat the rest!

original Spanish: Trabajar en el mar es duro pero más duro para mí ver como partes
original English: Working on the sea is hard but it is even harder to say goodbye to it.

original Spanish: Quizás para empezar podría olvidar el odio que siente por el nombre Wayne ...porque ese odio ha causado una grieta infranqueable ente él y Mónica.
original English: Perhaps but to start he should forget the hatred that he carries for the name Wayne ...because that hate has caused an unbridgable gap between him and Monica...

original Spanish: Tras ser criado en América éste regresa a Dunstable para establecerse definitivamente.
original English: After being raised in America this young man returns to Dunstable to settle there permanently.

original Spanish: Willy Ainley se preparó como un joven Romeo para la llegada de Kathleen.
original English: Willy Ainley prepared himself for the arrival of Kathleen as a young Romeo!

original Spanish: Uno debe tener un corazón de piedra para consentir un sacrificio tal.
original English: One must have a heart of stone to condone such a sacrifice.

original Spanish: ¿Crees que es suficiente con decir "Te necesito" para que olvide todo?
original English: Do you think that it is enough for you to say "I need you" to make me forget everything?

original Spanish: Miss Mary Conway saborea la nueva moda mientras posa como modelo para el famoso escultor Harry Lighton.
original English: Miss Mary Conway who is paying tribute to a new kind of fashion poses as a model for the well-known sculptor Harry Lighton.

original Spanish: ¡La mano que será bendecida es aquella que limpia este triste mundo presto para aniquilar!
original English: The hand shall be blessed that sweeps away this pitiful world which is ripe for annihilation!

original Spanish: El último intento para que Eduard volviera al camino virtuoso.
original English: A last attempt to lead Eduard back to the path of righteousness.

original Spanish: ¡La corte de apelación ha denegado la petición de clemencia para Mary Conway y Eduard Harber!
original English: The court of cassation has denied the petitions for clemency for Mary Conway and Eduard Harber!

original Spanish: Te he hecho venir para mirar en tus ojos una vez más y decirte  cuanto te quiero...
original English: I have sent for you - to look into your eyes once again and to tell you how much I love you...

original Spanish: Lista para ser destruida. En tus palacios el vicio está celebrando orgías como en la ciudad de Lot...!
original English: In your palaces vice celebrates orgies as once in the city of Lot...!

original Spanish: La esposa de Lot se prepara para la fiesta de Astarté.
original English: Lot's wife is preparing herself for the feast of Astarte.

original Spanish: ¿Señor envíanos tu ángel para que esta ciudad sea castigada!
original English: Lord please send your angel so that this sinful city can be punished!

original Spanish: ¡El Señor me envía para castigar a ete pueblo por sus pecados!
original English: The Lord has send me here so that I can punish this town for its sins!

original Spanish: ¡Cuidado extraño una órden mía es suficiente para sacrificarte en el templo de Astarté!
original English: Know stranger that one hint from me is enough to have you sacrificed in the temple of Astarte!

original Spanish: ¡La reina ordena ejecuciones para poseer más oro y plata!
original English: The queen gives an order to turn in all silver and gold on pain of capital punishment!

original Spanish: En la huida ella se gira para ver la ciudad pecadora y se convierte en una columna de sal.
original English: On the run she once again turns around and takes one last look at the city of sins and turns into a pillar of salt.

original Spanish: Vengo a tu Residencia a proponerte una alianza para la protección de la paz interior y exterior de nuestros reinos..
original English: I am visiting your residence to humbly offer you an alliance for the protection of the inner and outer peace of our Empires.

original Spanish: No pongáis en juego la apreciada vida de los trabajadores y dadme tiempo para la obra.
original English: Don't jeopardize the valuable lives of the workers and give me time for the construction.

original Spanish: ¿Estás preparado para hacer a los dioses un sacrificio matinal?
original English: Are you ready to offer the Gods a morning sacrifice?

original Spanish: ¡Señor del cielo padre de los dioses el Rey viene ante tu presencia para darte las gracias en estas horas matinales!
original English: Lord of the Heavens Father of the Gods the King is facing you to thank you in this morning hour.

original Spanish: ¿Se considera demasiado importante para ayudarme en mi toilette?
original English: She thinks too highly of herself to assist me with my decoration.

original Spanish: Se la lleva en una balsa que transportaba madera y objetos de valor para la nueva cámara del tesoro del Faraón.
original English: He kidnaps her on his raft that transports wood and valuables for the Pharaoh's new Treasury.

original Spanish: ¿No vamos a bajar para ver la cámara del tesoro de cerca?
original English: Don't we want to go down there to see the Treasury from nearby?

original Spanish: Tienes motivo para ser precavido.
original English: You have good reasons to be cautious.

original Spanish: ¡Lo haré todo para conseguir tu amor!
original English: I will do anything to win your heart.

original Spanish: Ciertos hombres de mala catadura han usado el nombre de vuestra ilustrísima señoría para asustar a un pobre cura y molestar a dos inocentes.
original English: Some dishonest men have hidden behind the name of Your Excellency to frighten a poor curate and overpower two innocents...

original Spanish: El canceller del ducado de Milán Antonio Ferrero quien para granjearse el favor del pueblo había rebajado arbitrariamente el precio del pan.
original English: Time ago the Chancellor of the Duchy of Milan Antonio Ferrero had arbitrarily lowered the price of bread in order to gain the people's favour.

original Spanish: Vengo para conducirlo a prisión.
original English: I am here to take him to prison! ...

original Spanish: ... Obediencia de fray Cristoforo para ir a Rimini donde predicará la cuagésima dejando todo pensamiento del país en que debe partir.
original English: It was an order for Friar Cristoforo to repair to Rimini for the purpose of preaching the Lent sermons giving up all thoughts of the business he has in the country he must leave...

original Spanish: Agnese sabedora con dolor de la partida de fray Cristoforo deja nuevamente su casa para volver al convento de Monza.
original English: Agnese aggrieved by Friar Cristoforo's departure left her home once again and returned to the convent in Monza.

original Spanish: Así Lucia se ve forzada a abandonar a su madre para seguir a doña Prassede. Mientras don Rodrigo al ver que su abominable empresa ha sido vana también parte hacia Milán.
original English: Thus Lucia was obliged to leave her mother and follow Donna Prassede whilst Don Rodrigo his loathsome deed having now proved futile he too set off for Milan.

original Spanish: El nombre del Innombrable animó a sus hombres no para acciones infames sino para liberar a los míseros oprimidos.
original English: The words of the Unnamed spurred his men no longer to commit villainous deeds but to free the oppressed!

original Spanish: Prepárate para hacer un sacrificio...
original English: I will seek her in one place or another And if I do not find her! Be prepared to make a sacrifice...

original Spanish: Esa mala pieza de mi hija se obstina en no darme dinero para comprar un vasito. -
original English: - Thanks thanks.

original Spanish: -- ¿Trabajar para ganar dinero?
original English: I have someone who gives it to me to Buy whatever I need!

original Spanish: ¡Tengo quien me lo da para comprarme lo que necesito!
original English: Who are you?

original Spanish: Sólo llevaba el uniforme para disimular y pasaba todo el día con
original English: I only wore the Uniform to hide and spent all day with

original Spanish: -- ¿Tendrás fuerzas suficientes para soportar la confesión de una duda que hará crecer el infierno de tus penas?
original English: - Will you have enough strength to withstand the confession of a Doubt that will grow into a hell of your sorrows?

original Spanish: - Sí sólo se casa con ese hombre para saber si Tore es inocente.
original English: - Yes she is only marrying that man to find out If Tore is innocent.

original Spanish: Nanninella se casa esta tarde con Carluccio para arrancarle la confesión de tu inocencia.
original English: Nanninella will marry Carluccio this afternoon in order to get a confession Of your innocence.

original Spanish: ¡El propietario de la fábrica aporta el dinero para que tengamos trabajo y carga con todos los riesgos del negocio...!
original English: The factory owner puts up the money so that we have work to do and carries the entire risk of the business!

original Spanish: Por favor por favor contribuyan también con lo suyo para que puedan salvarse muchos niños huérfanos y contribuyan todos a los señores de nuestra institución que entre Uds. están recogiendo para nosotros con todo lo que puedan Hoy aún somos pequeños
original English: Please please do contribute as many orphaned children like me can still be rescued. And give as much as you can to the men of our charity who want to collect for us.

original Spanish: Heiji prepara la trampa para su próxima presa.
original English: Heiji lays the trap for his next prey.

original Spanish: Llamémoslos para que vengan.
original English: Let's call them here.

original Spanish: Llamaremos a los vendedores para que vengan aquí.
original English: We will call the candy men here.

original Spanish: Es un desperdicio entrenarlo para ser samurai.
original English: It's a waste to train him to be a samurai.

original Spanish: Eres una deshonra para la casta samurai.
original English: You're a shame to the name of the samurai.

original Spanish: Humildemente debemos aceptar tu sacrificio y abandonar este pueblo para vivir en el exilio.
original English: We shall humbly accept your sacrifice and leave this town to live in exile.

original Spanish: Mi querido Beudet: Así como dispusimos esta tarde le envío incluido un palco para esta noche del que posiblemente puedan sacar provecho su mujer usted y la familia Lebas. Menard.
original English: Dear Beudet As arranged I send you loge tickets for tonight maybe you could bring your wife and your associate Lebas.

original Spanish: ¿Cómo tendría yo que hacer para vivir sin ti?
original English: 'How could I live without you?

original Spanish: Queridos invitados no les he hecho venir solamente para la inauguración de mi palacio sino porque tengo una jubilosa sorpresa.
original English: My dear guests I have not only invited you to this house warming but also to be witness to a joyous surprise.

original Spanish: Ponte tu traje bueno... vamos a salir para que cambies de ideas.
original English: Put on your best clothes and we'll go out... it'll clear your mind.

original Spanish: Quise crear escuelas para mi país... fomentar el Arte y la Ciencia...
original English: I wanted to create schools for my country ... promote the arts and sciences ...

original Spanish: ¿¡Tengo que firmar la paz ahora para que todo eso se quede en nada! ?
original English: Must I make peace now while there so much left to do!

original Spanish: Majestad para superar lo que está Ud. viviendo...
original English: Your Majesty to overcome what you have experienced ...

original Spanish: ¡Es para volverse loco!
original English: It will drive you crazy!

original Spanish: ¡Mis magiares no están para pasearse de aquí para allá!
original English: My Magyars are not here to go from one place to another!

original Spanish: Príncipe Dessau ¿qué regimiento me aconsejáis para el asalto a la colina?
original English: Prince Dessau which regiment do you want for the assault on the hill?

original Spanish: ¡Las barricadas están listas para el ataque!
original English: The barricades are ready to be attacked!

original Spanish: Mal tiempo para viajar.
original English: Bad weather for travel.

original Spanish: Se echó una vez al cuello de su padre para defender a su madre de él.
original English: Back then he jumped at the father's deer to shoot his mother in front of him.

original Spanish: Se recluye en este lugar oscuro y vive sólo para maldecir y rezar.
original English: She secludes herself in this dark place and lives but to curse and pray.

original Spanish: No es seguro para una criatura tan bella como vos ir sola a estas horas!
original English: It isn't safe for a pretty child like you to be out alone at this hour!

original Spanish: La Corte de los Milagros la ciudad de los ladrones repugnane borrón en la faz de Paris. Una cloaca de la que escapaba cada mañana y a la que volvía para estancarse cada noche
original English: The Court of Miracles - the city of thieves - a hideous blot on the face of Paris - a sink from whence escaped every morning and to which returned to stagnate every night that stream of vice and vagrancy which ever flows through the streets of a capital.

original Spanish: El "interrogatorio" - sistema medieval para forzar una confesión.
original English: The "question" - the system of the Middle Ages to force confession.

original Spanish: Él no sabía para qué pobre alma doblaría las campanas.
original English: For what poor soul he rang he did not know.

original Spanish: Con planes de rescatar a Esmeralda en su camino a la horca Clopin esperaba el día anunciado para la ejecución.
original English: With plans all made for rescuing Esmeralda on her way tot he gallows Clopin was awaiting the day that had been announced for the execution.

original Spanish: Temían una sublevación para rescatar a Esmeralda.
original English: They feared an uprising to rescue Esmeralda.

original Spanish: ¡Piénsalo tenemos muchas más razones para la tristeza que para el entusiasmo!
original English: Think about it we have far more reason for sorrow than enthusiasm.

original Spanish: Estoy decidido a pedirle hoy mismo a mi padre su consentimiento para que nos casemos.
original English: I have decided to ask my father to consent to our marriage today.

original Spanish: He prometido a mis amigos pasar por el 'Nußbaum' a despedirme antes de partir para el campo de batalla.
original English: I can't. I have promised my friends to bid farewell to them at the Nussbaum before entering the field.

original Spanish: Vete a casa de Klähr y deja estas flores para el fallecido Medardus sobre el cojín.
original English: Go to the Klähr house and put these flowers on dead Medardus's pillow.

original Spanish: Nosotros los Valois no tenemos derecho a llevar luto ni tiempo para pensar en la felicidad.
original English: We the Valois have no right to mourn and no time to think of love.

original Spanish: Mientras Napoleón entra victorioso en la ciudad el ejército austriaco reúne las últimas fuerzas en Aspern para la batalla decisiva.
original English: While Napoleon enters the city victoriously - the Austrian army at Aspern gathers its last strength for a decisive battle.

original Spanish: ¡Le digo y le juro que no tocará Ud. jamás ni la punta de mis dedos si no emprende esta misma noche el viaje hacia nuestros amigos que le están esperando para iniciar el ataque decisivo!
original English: And I swear to you that you won't touch even the tips of my fingers if you don't make the journey - to our friends who are waiting for you to start the decisive offensive.

original Spanish: ¿No va a decirme una palabra más cálida para el viaje que me dé fuerza en el peligro?
original English: Aren't you going to give me any warm words to strengthen me in danger?

original Spanish: ¿Está su marido quizás detrás de la cortina para matarme o ha mandado Ud. hacer agujeros en el techo para que sus criados se diviertan con el juego del gato y el ratón?
original English: Is your husband waiting behind the curtains in order to slay me? Or are there holes in the roof through which your servants may observe the game of cat-and-mouse?

original Spanish: ¡Has fingido pasión para comprarme!
original English: ! You feigned suffering in order to buy me.

original Spanish: Alteza... estos brazos fueron destinados para el Rey de Francia.
original English: Your Highness these arms were designated to the King of France.

original Spanish: Después de la victoria de su ejército en Aspern el Emperador abrió los jardines del palacio de Schönbrunn a los vieneses que vieron en esa decisión la buena voluntad de Napoleón para la paz.
original English: Following the victory of his army in Aspern the Emperor opened the palatial gardens of Schönbrunn - to the Viennese public who saw it as a gesture of peace.

original Spanish: Me embarco en un viaje alrededor del mundo para olvidarme de ti.
original English: I am embarking on a trip around the world so that I may forget all about you.

original Spanish: Llega justo a tiempo para la Misa
original English: * You Are Just In Time For The Services. *

original Spanish: Tengo el dinero para la hipoteca
original English: * I Have The Money For The Mortgage. *

original Spanish: Pero el párroco ha ido por él para regresarlos.
original English: * But The Paron Has Gone To Get It Back. *

original Spanish: Adaptada para la pantalla por W. Hennings y G. W. Pabst
original English: Adapted for the screen by W. Hennings and G. W. Pabst

original Spanish: Él sabe que para el dinero...
original English: He knows about the money ...

original Spanish: ¡Eh tú prepárate para la faena!
original English: Hey you get ready for work!

original Spanish: ¡Ha venido conmigo sólo para verte!
original English: He came with me just to see you!

original Spanish: - Sólo flirtea con usted para poner celoso al viejo duque.
original English: She only flirts with you... to make the old Duke jealous!

original Spanish: - - Me han llamado para dar una conferencia en París.
original English: I've been called to a conference in Paris...

original Spanish: Llegan cables del departamento de Exteriores e incluso una oferta para que Dufresne se encargue de un gabinete en Washington pero éste se sigue demorando.
original English: There came wires from the Foreign Department... even an offer to make him Chargé d'affaires in Washington... yet Dufresne lingered on.

original Spanish: He esperado mucho para que tuvieses éxito.
original English: I've waited long for this sucess.

original Spanish: Algunas despedidas y estoy listo para marchar.
original English: A few good-byes and I shall be ready to go.

original Spanish: -- ¡Construiré un teatro para ti para que rivalices con la Bernhardt!
original English: I'll build a theatre for you that will rival Bernhardt's.

original Spanish: - Ocupa la posición que algunas de ustedes damas del Odeón darían los dientes para conseguirla.
original English: She occupes the position that some of you ladies at the Odeon give yout eye-teeth for.

original Spanish: En los siete años que han pasado el mundo se ha estremecido hasta sus profundidades... para luego resurgir.
original English: In the seven years that passed the world was shaken to its depths... then settled down to clear its wreckage.

original Spanish: Una multitud entusiasta acudía al campo de aviación para asistir a las proezas del célebre aviador Raymat.
original English: An enthusiastic crowd gathered at the airfield to witness the exploits of the famous aviator Raymat.

original Spanish: Señora gracias por haber pensado en el amigo de Raymat para ayudarla a encontrar el reposo que busca.
original English: Madam thank you for thinking of Raymat's friend to help you find the rest you seek. I won't presume to discuss your decision

original Spanish: - Imbécil ¿No comprendes que si hago esto es para impedir que Hélène vuele y tal vez se mate?
original English: - Idiot I'm only doing this to prevent Hélène from flying and may be killing herself.

original Spanish: La mañana siguiente los directores llegaron al campo para asistir al primer vuelo de Hélène.
original English: The next morning the directors visited to the camp on the occasion of Hélène's first flight.

original Spanish: Y si usted quisiera hacernos el honor de concertar una cita le haríamos partícipes de las brillantes condiciones listas para que usted las firme y quede a la cabeza de nuestro personal de alto vuelo.
original English: ... and if you would be kind enough to fix an appointment with us we'll let you know about the brilliant contract that we are ready to sign to have you head our team of high-flyers.

original Spanish: - - Un aviador no es un jockey al que apostamos. Y mi valor ha quedado suficientemente probado en los campos de batalla para que ahora se ponga en duda.
original English: - An aviator is not a jockey you bet on... and my courage has soared over battlefields too many times for you to doubt it.

original Spanish: Su avión se incendió para desviar la atención.
original English: Your plane was set on fire just to divert attention.

original Spanish: Los fugitivos empleados para dar muerte a un poeta.
original English: The hats of the rascals hired to slay one poor poet.

original Spanish: Y cada día arriesgáis una vida ingrata como la vuestra para enviar una carta.
original English: And Cyrano laughs and risks his life each night "to send a letter.

original Spanish: Ahora dime por qué has corrido todos estos riesgos para verme.
original English: Now tell me why you came through all these dangers to me.

original Spanish: En vano luchaba la MUJER para escapar a su horrible pesadilla...
original English: A woman fought in vain to escape her horrible nightmare ...

original Spanish: ¿Habrá que ponerse de cabeza entonces para descifrar el alma de una mujer?
original English: Should we be heard then   to decipher the soul of a woman?

original Spanish: Aprovecharé para despedirme de su abuela.
original English: I will take advantage of the trip to say goodbye to his grandmother.

original Spanish: Declaro que vuelvo a mi país para nunca retornar a Francia.
original English: I declare that I will return to my country and never return to France.

original Spanish: Preparativos para la función de Clavigo en honor de Goethe.
original English: Preparing for the performance of Clavigo in honor of Goethe.

original Spanish: Solicito permiso a Vuestra Alteza para poder visitar a mi padre.
original English: L beg Your Highness for permission to visit my father.

original Spanish: Schiller revela a su amigo su plan para escribir un drama de los oprimidos.
original English: Schiller reveals to his friend his plan to write a play about the oppressed.

original Spanish: Iffland lee "Los bandidos" a los actores del Teatro Nacional de Mannheim que habían sido recomendados por el librero Schwan al director artístico Dalberg para el estreno.
original English: Iffland reads to the actors of the Mannheim National Theater: "The Robbers" which the bookseller Schwan has recommended to Dalberg to perform on stage.

original Spanish: Los bandidos" de Schiller que nos fue remitida tras un minucioso examen para ser representada en nuestro Teatro Nacional.
original English: To Regiment Dr. Schiller Honorable sir we inform you that we have selected the play "The Robbers

original Spanish: Es un peligro para el trono y para la sociedad.
original English: He is a danger to the throne and society

original Spanish: Padre no tiene que saber nada de mi huida para que pueda mirar libremente a los ojos al Duque.
original English: Father mustn't know about my flight so he can look the duke straight in the eyes.

original Spanish: Sin embargo Mikisaburo es demasiado joven para distinguir entre amor y simpatía.
original English: However Mikisaburo is too young to tell between love and sympathy.

original Spanish: Mikisaburo está enamorado Misao la hija del Maestro Kurahashi al que tiene en gran estima y en quien ha confiado su enseñanza para poder restaurar el honor de su familia.
original English: Mikisaburo's love for Misao his master in swords Sir Kurahashl's daughter kept him in high spirits as he promised himself to restore the Nanjo family's honor.

original Spanish: Sin embargo las normas de la jerarquía son tan estrictas que la familia Nanjo tiene grandes problemas para poder restaurar el honor perdido.
original English: However the hierarchy within the domain is so strict the Nanjo family is having extreme difficulty in regaining its honor.

original Spanish: Ella suele visitar un templo para rezar a los dioses.
original English: She visits a venerable temple in the domain to pray to the gods.

original Spanish: He venido para hablar con el joven maestro Genzaburo.
original English: I've come to speak with the young master Sir Genzaburo!

original Spanish: ¿Qué había hecho él para merecer ésto?
original English: What did he do to deserve this?

original Spanish: Desterrado... para escapar de la realidad había caído en la bebida.
original English: Expelled from his domain he had resorted to drinking to escape reality.

original Spanish: Tan duro e inflexible como sus antepasados el alguacil Thor Brekanæs era un ocupante apropiado para la casa en la Moraene.
original English: As hard and inflexible as his forefathers the bailiff Thor Brekanæs is a fitting occupant for the house on the Moraine.

original Spanish: Dejo mis estudios de Derecho para escribir libros.
original English: Your son Vasil.

original Spanish: - - Pero eso no es motivo para no dar los buenos días...
original English: - I'm so glad you have come home.

original Spanish: -- ¡Me costó mucho dinero hacerte estudiar para ser abogado!
original English: - It did cost me a great deal of money to make you study to become a lawyer!

original Spanish: Él no sabía que ésta era la canción que su madre solía tocar cuando lo llevaba bajo su corazón pero esos sonidos se combinaban de alguna manera para tocar las cuerdas de su alma y ahuyentar las tinieblas de su espíritu.
original English: He does not know that this is the song his mother used to play when she carried him under her heart but those sounds managed somehow to touch the strings of his soul and to chase the darkness from his spirit.

original Spanish: - Sé que he caído muy bajo ¡pero no lo suficiente como para que se le ponga la mano encima a Thor Brekanæs!
original English: - I know I've fallen very low but not low enough to shake Thor Brekanæs' hand!

original Spanish: - - Swein Gudmundson ¿está preparado para confirmar su declaración bajo juramento?
original English: - Swein Gudmundson are you prepared to confirm your statement by oath?

original Spanish: ¡Que Adonis dios de la primavera despierte para que vuelva a florecer la vida!
original English: Adonis the god of spring wakes up and returns the flowers to life!

original Spanish: Eres la elegida para la fiesta de Adonis.
original English: You have been chosen for the festival of Adonis.

original Spanish: Trae un año de paz para la sagrada ciudad de Troya.
original English: Bring a year of peace to the sacred city of Troy.

original Spanish: Reunidos están los príncipes de Grecia para honrarte con los juegos.
original English: The Greek princes are united in singing your praises.

original Spanish: Menelao se prepara para la carrera.
original English: Menelaus is preparing for the race.

original Spanish: Se acerca el vencedor para llevarme al barco.
original English: The winner already approaches to take me to the boat.

original Spanish: Mientras Héctor se prepara para la cacería viene Hécuba su madre en su busca.
original English: While Hector is preparing for the hunt Hecuba his mother comes to see him.

original Spanish: Me has hecho venir Afrodita para salvar a esa pareja te serviré con gratitud eterna.
original English: Have you called me Aphrodite to save this couple. I will serve you with eternal gratitude.

original Spanish: Un inmenso ejército de los griegos marcha sobre Troya para reclamar a la raptada.
original English: A huge army of Greeks march on Troy to recover Helen.

original Spanish: Hay suficientes mujeres infieles en Grecia... para ofrecerte coronas de vencedor. ¿Para qué necesitas a Elena?
original English: Why do you need to win Helen?

original Spanish: Aquiles no hace la guerra para volverse a casa sin gloria.
original English: Achilles will not go home from the war without glory.

original Spanish: El rey Príamo busca el consejo de los ancianos para salvar a Troya agotada por la guerra.
original English: King Priam convenes the council of elders to save Troy exhausted by war.

original Spanish: Héctor agitó el casco y salió elegido Paris para hacer el primer lanzamiento.
original English: Hector shook the helmet and the lot with Paris's name came out. Paris was selected to strike the first blow.

original Spanish: ¡Te buscaba Aquiles para morir con gloria!
original English: I was looking for Achilles so I could die with glory!

original Spanish: ¡Corona a los cautivos para el sacrificio Elena!
original English: Let them give to the prisoners the crown of the victims Helen!

original Spanish: ¡Entréganos el cadáver de Héctor para enterrarlo!
original English: Hector's body in order to give him his last rites.

original Spanish: Llévate el cadáver de tu hijo. Sólo necesito la corona de vencedor de manos de Elena para honrar con ella la tumba de mi amigo.
original English: I only need to receive from Helen's hands my crown of victory to honor my friend's grave.

original Spanish: No pudiste darme la mano desde tu lecho de muerte ni concederme una palabra de despedida para poder recordarlas día y noche entre lágrimas y tristeza.
original English: I could not hear your last cry nor press your hand for a last time nor hear your last words to remind me of night and day.

original Spanish: Mirit para tener a Ennio con ella recurre a estratagemas.

original English: Then why struggle - why suffer more?

original English: Tell me of your youth or why you are so gloomy and in such a bad mood today... or rather why your eyes so fearfully evade mine.

original Spanish: En dias soleados nunca saliais triste y compungido sin que supieras por que?

original Spanish: ¡Gracias por mi vida!

original English: One evening Paris went to sleep and the following morning the night watchman in the Eiffel Tower wonders why not a thing is stirring in the city and since no one comes...
